info.title: Meetup Streams API
info.description: The API for managing Meetup streams.

ws.description: nFor browsers that support it, [WebSockets](http://dev.w3.org/html5/websockets/) is a morenefficient alternative to the long-polling stream. This is a **push only** endpoint and will discardnany messages received from the client after the socket is open.nnBecause browser support for WebSockets is limited, we recommend that you consume this streamnthrough the [must.js](https://github.com/meetup/must.js#readme) client, which can fallback to long-polling.n

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: Limit notifications to a specific event id. Use alphanumeric ids for repeating events.

parameters.name: since_count
parameters.description: Request that some number of recent messages be sent immediately, if available. May not be specified in the same request as since_mtime.

parameters.name: since_mtime
parameters.description: Return recent Event Comments with an mtime greater than the supplied time, in milliseconds since the epoch

This is a **push only** endpoint and will discardnany messages received from the client after the socket is open.nnBecause browser support for WebSockets is limited, we recommend that you consume this streamnthrough the [must.js](https://github.com/meetup/must.js#readme) client, which can fallback to long-polling.n

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: Limit notifications to a specific event id. Use alphanumeric ids for repeating events.

parameters.name: since_count
parameters.description: Request that some number of recent messages be sent immediately, if available. May not be specified in the same request as since_mtime.

parameters.description: Return recent RSVPs with an mtime greater than the supplied time, in milliseconds since the epoch
